alert.note: Alert for Berkeley (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 9:15PM EDT until May 08 at 3:38PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT SUNDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of panhandle West Virginia, including the following county: Berkeley. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 915 PM EDT, gauge reports indicated rapidly rising water on Back Creek. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Hedgesville... Tomahawk... Glengary... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
